alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Southeast Middlesex; Western Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 1:08PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Norfolk, southwestern Essex, eastern Worcester and eastern Middlesex Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 108 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Framingham, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lowell, Newton, Framingham, Waltham, Arlington, Billerica, Woburn, Chelmsford, Natick, Watertown, Lexington, Tewksbury, Needham, Wellesley, Wakefield, Reading, Belmont, Burlington, Wilmington and Acton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Southeast Middlesex; Western Norfolk
